Module chessClockWork
Package time

Class TimeControlPhase

java.lang.Object
time.TimeControlPhase
public final class TimeControlPhase extends Object
The time control phase determines the amount of time a player has for a certain amount of moves.
In case the time budget is not limited to a certain amount of moves, the constant INF can be set for the move number.
Since:
1.0;

  • Method Details

    • makeNew

      public static TimeControlPhase makeNew(short moves, int time, int increment)
      Creates a new instance.
      Parameters:
      moves - The number of moves in this phase. Non-positive values indicate a phase that lasts for the rest of the game.
      time - The time for this phase of the game, in seconds. Becomes unity if non-positive.
      increment - The time added after each turn made, in seconds. Set to 0 for negative values.
      Returns:
      The new instance.
      Since:
      1.0;

    • makeNew

      public static Optional<TimeControlPhase> makeNew(TimeControlPhase tcp)
      Creates a deep copy of the given phase.
      Parameters:
      tcp - Original we take a copy from.
      Returns:
      Optional with the copy. If null is passed, an empty optional is returned.
      Since:
      1.0;

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Checks of this and other represent time control phases of equal conditions.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - The object that might or might not be equal to this.
